citations.narrative:
An inspector present on June 16, 2023 witnessed several enclosures that allow direct public contact with the animals
without a readily identifiable attendant present. A large number of enclosures only have a primary enclosure fence, either
metal chain link or horizontal wood beams, that allow the public to directly contact the animals through the fencing gaps.
The enclosures include the following species: 4 Adult Reticulated Giraffes, 58 Adult and Juvenile Fallow Deer, 13 Reeves
Muntjac, 22 Llamas, 2 Adult Zebras, 36 Pygmy Goats, 1 Dall Sheep, 5 Kudu Antelope, 13 East African Oryx and 18
Sitatunga Antelope. The facility also sells feed and maintains feeding stations, allowing the public to feed the animals
without public attendants. The inspector saw the public actively interacting with llamas without an employing monitoring
the interactions. A readily identifiable attendant is necessary to protect both the animals and the public from inappropriate
and/or unsafe interactions. Correct by June 30, 2023 by ensuring there is either a responsible, knowledgeable, and
readily identifiable employee or attendant present at all times during periods of public contact or sufficient distance and/or
barriers between the animal and the general viewing public.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
Additional Inspectors:
MICHAEL TYGART, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n
